Bibliographic Ghosts: Oxford, Merton College 23.b.6 [Ker Pastedowns 919]: this is fragment of Robert Manning’s Chronicle; see 3253.
_description: Richard Coer de Lion — 7262 lines in couplets

CamGon175.First Lines:
Lord thu kyng off gloryeWhyche grace &
                    uyctorye…
CamGon175.Last Lines:
…And hys soule reste & rooAnd oure soules whene we come
                    þer to
CamGon175.Attributed Title: Hic incipit uita Ricardi regis primi (p. 1)
CamGon175.Editions:
Brunner,  Karl. 
             Der mittelenglische Versroman über Richard Löwenherz.
Wiener Beiträge
         42. Vienna: Braümuller, 1913. 
Weber,  Henry William. 
             Metrical Romances of the Thirteenth, Fourteenth, and Fifteenth
                Centuries.
         3 vols. Edinburgh: A. Carstalle, 1810: 2.278.

BLEge2862.First Lines: …He made his clothes and his tresoure[] was =þat for [ ]…
BLEge2862.Last Lines: … To Olyuete and to Nazareth wellTo Iaffys and to Maiden Castel…
BLEge2862.Note: Begins and ends imperfectly; lines 1847-7124. First several leaves illegible due to water damage, first lines above are from f. 4; ends incomplete at bottom of f. 44v.

BLHar4690.First Lines:
That itte was Richarde the kinggeHe wende he hadde be att
                    Salesbury…
BLHar4690.Last Lines:
…That hath owse grevedd full soreOn a seynt Iames day
                    verament

BLAdd31042.First Lines: Lorde Ihesu Criste kyng of gloryThe faire grace and the victoryeþat thou sent to kynge Richerde…
BLAdd31042.Last Lines: …And thus Endys þe Romaunce of Richard oure kyngeAnd god graunte vs alle gude Endynge
BLAdd31042.Note:
Variant: vv. 6380; vv. 6315-6604 missing, and other leaves
                    mutilated. Ends “Amen.”
BLAdd31042.Attributed Title: Explicit The Romance Off Kyng Richard þe Conqueroure (f. 163va)

NLS1921.First Lines:
Lord Ihesu king of glorieSwiche auentour & swiche
                    victorie…
NLS1921.Last Lines:
…Wel mani kniȝt du[ ] es dedeAfter him priked on her
                    nede…
NLS1921.Note:
Lines 1-168 and 2783-2957, first 24 lines in 12-line stanzas
                    aabccbddbeeb, then couplets. Two other fragments from this MS are now Edinburgh,  Edinburgh University Library 218 and St Andrews,  St Andrews University Library PR2065.R4 (see below).
NLS1921.Facsimiles:
Pearsall,  Derek,  and  I. C. Cunningham, eds.  
             The Auchinleck Manuscript. National Library of Scotland
                Advocates’ MS. 19.2.1.
         London: Scolar Press, 1977.

EDU218.Note:
Two fragments, originally in Edinburgh,  National Library of Scotland, Advocates’ 19.2.1 [Auchinleck MS], between ff.
                        326vb and 327ra; lines 1753-1928 and
                    2593-2782.
EDU218.Editions:
Laing,  David,  and  William Barclay David Donald Turnbull, eds.  
             Owain Miles &c.
         Edinburgh, 1837. 
Kölbing,  Eugen. 
             “Kleine Publicationen aus der Auckinleck-HS: III. Zwei Fragmente von
                King Richard.” 
             Englische Studien
         8 (1885): 115-19: 115-19.

StAPR2065R4.Last Lines:
…No no of al mi barnageNo schal þe neuer don
                    om
StAPR2065R4.Note:
Two fragments, originally in Edinburgh,  National Library of Scotland, Advocates’ 19.2.1 [Auchinleck MS], between ff.

StAPR2065R4.Editions:
Smithers,  G. V.

Badminton.Note:
Fragment; see Davis (1969)
XDavis,  Norman. 
             “Another Fragment of ‘Richard Coer de Lyon’.” 
             Notes and Queries
         16 (1969): 447-452, for an extensive study of this
                    fragment. Contains lines 2732-2772; 2852-90; 2891-930; 2931-68; and on the
                    fourth side, ‘two columns, the first beginning at line 2969, the second at
                    3007, each containing apparently 40 lines though many of those lower on the page
                    cannot now be read’ (Davis 1969, p. 448).
